snippet: President Obama pledged to fight for a higher minimum wage, more government investment in schools and clean energy, and deficit reduction through spending cuts and tax increases.
abstract: President Obama, seeking to put prosperity and promise of the middle class at heart of his second-term agenda, calls on Congress in his State of the Union address to raise minimum wage to $9 an hour, saying it will lift millions out of poverty and energize the economy; Republicans reject idea, warning it would translate into higher taxes and a government that would strangle growth, deepening the nation's fiscal hole; Obama also urges lawmakers to act on immigration, gun control and other domestic policies.
lead_paragraph: President Obama pledged to fight for a higher minimum wage, more government investment in schools and clean energy, and deficit reduction through spending cuts and tax increases.

headline.seo: Obama Focuses on ‘Thriving Middle Class’ in Speech
headline.main: Obama Pledges Push to Lift Economy for Middle Class
headline.print_headline: Obama Vows Push to Life Economy for Middle Class
headline.sub: Obama Presses Bold Federal Efforts to Lift Americans
